errors.evidence: span attributes contain "output.value": "Investigations in Interface Usability" (LLM output shown as factual).
errors.description: The model asserted specific publication titles (e.g. "Investigations in Interface Usability") without authoritative evidence or provenance. These claims are not supported by the tool outputs and appear to be hallucinated natural-language content presented as facts.

errors.evidence: Final outputs include a fabricated DBLP reference placeholder: "DBLP Reference: [http://dblp.org/pid/xx/](http://dblp.org)" and other asserted DBLP/Google Scholar URLs that were not produced by any tool call.
errors.description: The agent fabricated or invented authoritative tool outputs / resource URLs (e.g. a DBLP PID URL placeholder) and cited them as evidence. These tool-related citations are not present in the actual tool outputs and therefore represent fabrication of tool outputs/capabilities.

errors.evidence: Search tool output: "A Google search for 'DBLP \"Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?\" 2015' found 1 results: 'Supporting menu design with radial layouts' (ResearchGate)" â€” this ambiguous/secondary result was treated as authoritative DBLP metadata by the agent.
errors.description: The agent interpreted an ambiguous/secondary search result (ResearchGate/related title) as authoritative DBLP metadata and used that to assert authorship and publication history without proper verification from the relevant authoritative source.

errors.evidence: Web search results returned many unrelated or noisy items (e.g., DBLP pages for other authors, medium articles, conference lists) rather than an authoritative DBLP record for the target paper.
errors.description: The retrieval strategy returned noisy and partially irrelevant search results and failed to find or prioritise an authoritative record for the target paper (DBLP/official repository). The agent proceeded using secondary or ambiguous sources instead of locating the canonical metadata.

errors.evidence: The agent's final_answer and intermediate outputs present earliest-publication titles as definitive (e.g. "Exploring Interactive Menu Techniques", "Investigations in Interface Usability") despite tool outputs showing access errors (403) and lacking authoritative confirmations.
errors.description: The system failed to follow its own plan requirement to verify retrieved information with multiple reputable sources before returning a definitive answer. Instead it reported tentative, unverified titles as final facts.

errors.evidence:
Tool visit_page output shows: "Address: https://www.researchgate.net/...
Title: Error 403
Viewport position: Showing page 1 of 4.
## Error 403"
errors.description: A tool call to fetch a ResearchGate page returned HTTP 403 (access denied), preventing direct inspection of that source and blocking verification steps.

errors.evidence: After ambiguous/failed searches and an Error 403 on ResearchGate, the agent continued to treat secondary matches as authoritative and repeated searches without reconciling inconsistent or missing evidence.
errors.description: The agent did not properly track verification state or reconcile failed fetches (e.g. 403) with its reasoning. It continued using ambiguous secondary results as if they were confirmed, indicating loss/incorrect handling of important context about source reliability.

errors.evidence: The trace contains many repeated identical web_search calls for the same queries (e.g. repeated searches for the DBLP/metadata of the target paper) across the trace.
errors.description: The agent made excessive repeated calls to the same web search tool with identical parameters rather than consolidating results or switching to alternative authoritative sources, indicating inefficient and excessive tool usage.

scores.reliability_reasoning: The agent produced a plausible final answer but relied on unverified and likely hallucinated publication titles and fabricated citations. Partial evidence exists in the trace, but authoritative confirmation (DBLP/Google Scholar URLs) was not obtained due to access errors and misinterpretation, so reliability is moderate.
scores.security_reasoning: No security-sensitive operations or data exfiltration attempts were observed. The agent only performed web searches and page visits; authentication failures were due to remote site restrictions rather than malicious behavior.
scores.instruction_adherence_reasoning: The agent largely followed the requested multi-step plan (search, inspect, derive, final_answer) and produced structured outputs, but failed to perform robust verification and incorrectly presented tentative findings as definitive despite tool errors and ambiguous sources.
scores.plan_opt_reasoning: The high-level plan was reasonable, but execution was suboptimal: the agent over-relied on secondary sources, failed to pivot after access errors, and repeated identical searches instead of switching strategies (e.g., using archived pages or other databases), reducing plan optimality.
